DOC.brief_title: Effects Robotic-assisted Gait Training In Non-Ambulatory Patients After Guillain-Barré Syndrome
DOC.detailed_description: Guillain-Barré syndrome ( GBS ) acute autoimmune disease peripheral nervous system , may lead rapidly develop motor deficit , sensory deficit , autonomic dysfunction respiratory failure . Approximately , 20.3 % patient walk unaided 4 week symptom onset 18.0 % 6 month . So , restoration improvement independent walk one major goal GBS rehabilitation . For severely affected neurological patient , gait train use conventional therapy technically difficult due motor weakness balance problem . Robotic-assisted gait training （RAGT）is effective alternative treadmill therapy partial body weight intense gait rehabilitation neuropathy . And proven reliability safety RAGT suggest may effective treat non-ambulatory patient neuropathy . In study , investigate anti-inflammatory effect RAGT non-ambulatory patient GBS .
DOC.criteria: Clinical diagnosis GBS ; Age 18 65 year ; Period GBS 4 8 week ; severe walking disability , define GBS disability score 24 ; An unstable phase disease ; Disorders prevent RAGT ( eg , unstable cardiovascular , respiratory disease , orthopedic , neurological condition , unhealed decubitus , orthostatic hypotension etc . ) ; Severe cognitive impairment prevent meaningful communication ; Body weight 100 kg ; Pregnancy ;
